summary: Howard L Shapiro is identified as an employee of the U.S. House of Representatives Select Committee on Assassinations (HSCA) based on payroll and certification reports from 1978. The documents list Shapiro's position and salary within the committee. While the specific role or contribution of Shapiro to the HSCA's investigation is not detailed in these documents, the records confirm their employment during the period when the committee was actively investigating the assassination of President John F. Kennedy.
significance: Howard L Shapiro's significance lies in their employment with the HSCA during its investigation into the JFK assassination.
